body:
Theory time

So I was watching age of ultron and I noticed something

And then Dr Strange in infinity war is like “we’re in the endgame now” when Tony asks him why he gave up the time stone

What if Dr Strange had seen Tony’s past so he knew how vital he would be in the future for defeating Thanos? He’s referencing something that Tony had previously said, maybe to let Tony know that he didn’t just give up the time stone to save Tony, he did it to save the universe. Idk I just thought this was kind of interesting

And then there are all the rumors that a4 is called end game

I like Hetalia, Homestuck, Undertale, Doctor Who, Harry Potter/Fantastic Beasts, Gravity Falls, Stranger Things, Finding Nemo/Dory, Disney, The School for Good and Evil, Smosh, Camp Camp, Red vs Blue, RWBY, X-Ray and Vav, Lazer Team, The Good Doctor, Rise of the Guardians, The Greatest Showman, Sanders Sides, MCU, Detroit: Become Human, Welcome to Night Vale, Avatar: The Last Airbender, Webtoons, My Hero Academia, Umbrella Academy, The Dragon Prince, and The Moomins.

summary: I feel like Disney has a Double Standard.
body:
I feel like Disney has a Double Standard.

If you didn’t know, Disney recently fired James Gunn over inappropriate tweets made ten years ago. It was over very quickly.

However, in the case of John Lasseter, it took years for something to be done about his frequent harassment.

Gunn was fired over distasteful, ten year old, jokes; whereas Lasseter announced his own leave after years of actually harassing and objectifying many of his co-workers.

If Disney is going to deal with these issues, then they cannot pick and choose who leaves and who stays after these issues come up. Either fire all of the people guilty of these offences or ignore it all.

We all know what the more just option is.

Furthermore, the severity of these offences should be taken into account if Disney does want to pick and choose. A one and done thing should not be more pressing than years of repeated offences.

Disney’s double standard affects so many people and they need to get their shit together.

blog.name: words-n-shtuff
blog.title: I Attempt To Write Things
blog.description:
Hi! Welcome to my fanfic blog where the bio is long and the writing is trash.

A lil about me, um, I’m a Christian gurl (means I believe in God and all that Jazz), I love dogs with all my heart, I like food, dancing, singing, acting, I just like creative shtuff, I’m a major introvert and I panic when I get asks that I don’t know how to answer, I have like 2 friends, and I like writing but I’m crap at it. :)

I’ll write for Newsies, Marvel, Detroit: Become Human, and Harry Potter and maybe other stuff but you’d have to ask for it. I don’t do smut, and I only write m/f. I have nothing against anything else I’m just not comfortable writing them, sorry.

My main blog is @yourfriendlyneighborhoodnewsie so you can check that out if ya like. And uh, I think that’s it, please enjoy my crappy writing :)

title: Mouse
body:
Mobster!Tom Holland x Reader 

Summary: Y/n is usually really quiet and reserved, preferring not to draw much attention to herself. But one day she walks into her boyfriends office only to find him being rude and totally disrespectful to a woman who deserves the respect of the whole world. So Y/n, despite her introvertedness, decides to call him out on it right then and there. 

Warnings: Cursing, angst (?), and I think that’s it???

Ok so literally only three people read my last fic which is fine obviously except for the fact that it actually really hurts for some reason but oh well that’s not important I just had this really awesome idea for a short lil fic and I was gonna make it a request to someone and be lazy but then I decided that I waned to write it myself. Nobody is gonna see this or like this but it’s whatever so here we go. 

~~~~~~~~~~

Y/N POV

With my fresh coffee in one hand and my favorite book in the other, I stepped into the elevator up to my boyfriend, Tom’s office. Often when he’s not out “doing business,” he’s up in his office dealing with paperwork and things; and sometimes when I’m having a really boring day at the house, I’ll come to his office and read on the couch while he’s doing paperwork at his desk. I do it a lot and now mos of his workers recognize me and let me right on through. So here I stand in the elevator, tapping my foot to the soft music and waiting patiently for the elevator to arrive at the top floor. 

Along the way, it would stop and people would get on or off. I never talked to any of them, we exchanged respectful nods, but we otherwise did not talk. It’s not that I don’t like them or anything, it’s just that I’m not exactly a people person and I hate talking to strangers. And attention. And public speaking. And new people that I don’t know. 

Anyways I finally made it up to the top floor. My coffee was almost gone at this point so I tossed it into a nearby trashcan before greeting the receptionist in front of Tom’s office. 

“Hello Miss Y/L/N, here to see Mr. Holland,” she asked brightly with a broad smile. I nodded my head and mumbled a quiet ‘Yeah’ in response. 

“Alright, well just head on in. He’s finishing up a meeting with Miss Julia Smith, you know her, but he should be about done.” I stopped for a second, “Is she the one that-

“That saved your life at the gala last month? Yes,” she finished for me. 

I smiled, “Right. of course. Thank you.” 

I walked up to his office and opened the door, eager to see my boyfriend and favorite agent of his, as gingerly as I could, hoping to go in with minimal disruption. 

“Why would I send you, of all people, out into the field? Could you imagine? A woman, doing a mission by herself? Well first of all you’re not nearly strong enough for a solo mission, nor do you have the abilities to even gather the simplest of information. How could you? You’re a woman.”

I stopped in my tracks, furious at my boyfriends words. 

“Mr.Holland, me being a woman has nothing to do with my abilities to gather information. I can get the job done and I can do it more efficiently than most of your men,” the woman defended. Tom chuckled heartlessly, and stood from his chair, 

“You are not going on this mission alone, you’re just a woman.”

“Excuse me,” I blurted out, for once, without thinking.  

“Oh Y/n, darling, you’re he-”

“I’m sorry but did I just hear you telling this very capable agent that she can’t go on a mission because she’s a woman,” I seethed, beyond angry and with fury evident in my voice and demeanor. Tom visibly gulped and nodded his head, obviously shocked at my visible anger. 

“What the hell makes you think that just because she is a woman that she won’t be able to complete this mission? And who the hell do you think you are to tell her that her abilities are anything less than excellent when, very clearly she is the best agent you have? This woman saved my life when none of your other men were even aware of a threat? What the hell is wrong with you that you think any of what you just said was okay? If I ever hear you talking to her, or any women, so disrespectfully and with such misogyny and sexism I will not hesitate to to use your own knife to slit your throat. DO you understand me,” I growled. 

Silence followed, both too stunned by my justified outburst. “Do you understand me,” I barked, making him jump. 

“Yes, yes I understand darling, I’m so so sorry,” Tom rushed out, his voice quiet and fearful, which, for a mobster, was really not like him. 

“Don’t apologize to me, apologize to her,” I shouted, riding the wave of anger as far as it would take me. 

Quickly, Tom turned to Julia, “Julia, I’m very sorry of the way I spoke to you. It was misogynistic and rude and I apologize. I will send you the information you need, you will be going by yourself. I do hope you’ll forgive me,” he spoke with a regretful, sincere expression. 

She gave him a curt nod and replied, “Apology accepted, sir.” She quickly turned away and left. Not before ginning at me and mouthing a quick ‘thank you.’ I grinned and nodded. 

The door closed behind her and Tom let out a deep breath, as though he’d held it the entire time and looked at me with a shocked and fearful face. “Y/n, dear,” worry clear in his voice, unsure of what to expect from me.

I set my stuff down before walking over to him, stopping just before him. I let out a breath and grabbed his hand. “Tom, I love you, I really do.”

“But,” he asked, worried I was about to breakup with him. 

I took  a deep breath, “Just- just promise me you’ll never treat anybody like that again, please.” He nodded vigorously, “Of course darling, of course I promise! I’m so sorry, sweet heart.”

I looked up at him, his eyes were actually beginning to brim, with tears, his eyebrows knitted with concern and I could tell he was sincerely remorseful. I sighed and smiled gently, standing up on my toes to place a kiss on his lips which he welcomed gratefully. 

“Sorry I scared you,” I said with a smirk making him laugh. 

“You didn’t scare me,” he replied unconvincingly. 

“Yeah okay, and I didn’t just kiss you,” I quipped. 

“Ok, alright, you did scare me. But in my defense I’ve only ever heard you yell at the television, but that’s always cute because you’re never really that serious,” Tom replied defeated. 

I laughed and shook my head, “Whatever you say babe,” I mumbled and pulled him down into a loving kiss. 

~~~~~~~~~~ 

So that’s that ad I’m actually really kinda proud of it? Which sucks because I don’t think anyone’s gonna see this sooooo….. Imma just post it and suffer in silence. 

But I hope you liked it if you did read this! Please lemme know what you think and stuff! 

k bye.

Summary: Y/n is usually really quiet and reserved, preferring not to draw much attention to herself. But one day she walks into her boyfriends office only to find him being rude and totally disrespectful to a woman who deserves the respect of the whole world. ~~~~~~~~~~

Y/N POV

With my fresh coffee in one hand and my favorite book in the other, I stepped into the elevator up to my boyfriend, Tom’s office. Often when he’s not out “doing business,” he’s up in his office dealing with paperwork and things; and sometimes when I’m having a really boring day at the house, I’ll come to his office and read on the couch while he’s doing paperwork at his desk. I do it a lot and now mos of his workers recognize me and let me right on through. So here I stand in the elevator, tapping my foot to the soft music and waiting patiently for the elevator to arrive at the top floor. 

Along the way, it would stop and people would get on or off. I never talked to any of them, we exchanged respectful nods, but we otherwise did not talk. It’s not that I don’t like them or anything, it’s just that I’m not exactly a people person and I hate talking to strangers. And attention. And public speaking. And new people that I don’t know. 

Anyways I finally made it up to the top floor. My coffee was almost gone at this point so I tossed it into a nearby trashcan before greeting the receptionist in front of Tom’s office. 

“Hello Miss Y/L/N, here to see Mr. Holland,” she asked brightly with a broad smile. I nodded my head and mumbled a quiet ‘Yeah’ in response. 

“Alright, well just head on in. He’s finishing up a meeting with Miss Julia Smith, you know her, but he should be about done.” I stopped for a second, “Is she the one that-

“What the hell makes you think that just because she is a woman that she won’t be able to complete this mission? This woman saved my life when none of your other men were even aware of a threat? What the hell is wrong with you that you think any of what you just said was okay? If I ever hear you talking to her, or any women, so disrespectfully and with such misogyny and sexism I will not hesitate to to use your own knife to slit your throat. DO you understand me,” I growled.

“Yes, yes I understand darling, I’m so so sorry,” Tom rushed out, his voice quiet and fearful, which, for a mobster, was really not like him. 

“Don’t apologize to me, apologize to her,” I shouted, riding the wave of anger as far as it would take me. 

Quickly, Tom turned to Julia, “Julia, I’m very sorry of the way I spoke to you. It was misogynistic and rude and I apologize. I will send you the information you need, you will be going by yourself. I do hope you’ll forgive me,” he spoke with a regretful, sincere expression. 

She gave him a curt nod and replied, “Apology accepted, sir.” She quickly turned away and left. Not before ginning at me and mouthing a quick ‘thank you.’ I grinned and nodded. 

The door closed behind her and Tom let out a deep breath, as though he’d held it the entire time and looked at me with a shocked and fearful face. “Y/n, dear,” worry clear in his voice, unsure of what to expect from me.

I set my stuff down before walking over to him, stopping just before him. I let out a breath and grabbed his hand. “Tom, I love you, I really do.”

“But,” he asked, worried I was about to breakup with him. 

I took  a deep breath, “Just- just promise me you’ll never treat anybody like that again, please.” He nodded vigorously, “Of course darling, of course I promise! I’m so sorry, sweet heart.”

I looked up at him, his eyes were actually beginning to brim, with tears, his eyebrows knitted with concern and I could tell he was sincerely remorseful. I sighed and smiled gently, standing up on my toes to place a kiss on his lips which he welcomed gratefully. 

“Sorry I scared you,” I said with a smirk making him laugh.
